intro: Connarus nicobaricus, commonly known as the Nicobar connarus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands in the Indian Ocean. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in dense tropical forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
